doc:
Anne Shirley (actress) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Shirley_(actress) 0 Anne Shirley (born Dawn Evelyeen Paris, April 17, 1918 – July 4, 1993) was an American actress. Beginning her career as a child actress under the stage name Dawn O'Day, Shirley adopted the name of the character she played in the film adaptation of Anne of Green Gables in 1934, and achieved a successful career in supporting roles. Among her films is Stella Dallas (1937), for which she was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. She retired from acting in 1944, at the age of 26. She remained in Los Angeles, where she died at the age of 75. Anne_Shirley ( born Dawn_Evelyeen_Paris , April_17_,_1918 – July_4_,_1993 ) was an_American_actress . Beginning her_career as a_child_actress under the_stage_name_Dawn_O'Day , Shirley adopted the_name of the_character she played in the_film_adaptation of Anne of Green_Gables in 1934 , and achieved a_successful_career in supporting_roles . Among her_films is Stella_Dallas_(_1937_) , for which she was_nominated for an_Academy_Award for Best_Supporting_Actress . She retired from acting in 1944 , at the_age of 26 . She remained in Los_Angeles , where she died at the_age of 75 .
